faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about our rates and services

pricing.question: How do you calculate your translation rates?
pricing.answer: Our rates are calculated per source word, with variable prices depending on the language combination, technical specialization and deadlines. We offer discounted rates for large volumes and preferential rates for our regular customers.

deadlines.question: What are your delivery deadlines?
deadlines.answer: Deadlines depend on the volume and complexity of the project. On average, we translate 2000 to 3000 words per day. For urgent projects, we offer an express service with price supplement.

revisions.question: Do you offer revisions after delivery?
revisions.answer: Yes, we offer free minor revisions within 7 days of delivery. For major modifications or brief changes, a supplementary quote will be established.

native.question: Do you work with native translators?
native.answer: Absolutely. All our translators are native speakers of the target language and specialized in their field of expertise. This guarantees the linguistic and cultural quality of our translations.

confidentiality.question: How do you guarantee confidentiality?
confidentiality.answer: We sign confidentiality agreements (NDA) for all our projects. Your documents are stored securely and deleted after archiving according to our general conditions.

formats.question: Do you accept all types of file formats?
formats.answer: We work with most formats: Word, PDF, Excel, PowerPoint, InDesign, HTML, XML, etc. For special formats, we confirm feasibility when analyzing your request.

proofreading.question: Do you offer proofreading services only?
proofreading.answer: Yes, we offer proofreading and revision services for already translated texts. This service is charged at a reduced rate compared to a complete translation.

payment.question: How does payment work?
payment.answer: For new clients, we ask for a 50% deposit upon order. The balance is payable upon delivery. Our regular clients benefit from 30-day payment terms.

hero.title: AI and
hero.subtitle: An essential collaboration for the future of professional translation

intro.lead: Translation is much more than a simple passage from one language to another: it is the foundation of cultural and economic exchanges. Long reserved for linguistic experts, it is now being disrupted by the rise of artificial intelligence (AI).
intro.paragraph1: In just a few years, automatic translation tools have become essential allies. Fast, powerful and increasingly accurate, they profoundly modify the way translators work. But how far can AI go? Can it really replace humans?
intro.paragraph2: In this article, we explore the role of AI in translation, its advantages, its limitations and the future of human-machine collaboration.

aiRole.title: The role of AI in translation
aiRole.paragraph1: AI-based automatic translation systems analyze the source text and translate it instantly into the target language. Thanks to advanced algorithms, they preserve syntax, grammar and the overall meaning of the text.
aiRole.highlightSuccess: ‚û°Ô∏è Their main asset? Speed: massive volumes of content can be translated in seconds.
aiRole.highlightWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è But AI is not infallible. Some errors, awkwardness or mistranslations still appear, making the intervention of a human translator essential for revision and cultural adaptation.

collaboration.title: AI and translators: an essential collaboration
collaboration.paragraph1: For translation professionals, AI is not a threat but a complementary tool. The process generally relies on two steps:
collaboration.step1: Automatic translation using an AI tool.
collaboration.step2: Human revision by a native translator, who refines the text, corrects inconsistencies and restores the cultural and stylistic dimension.
collaboration.highlightInfo: üëâ Result: faster, more accurate translations, but always enriched with human sensitivity.

advantages.title: The advantages of translation with AI
advantages.paragraph1: Artificial intelligence is transforming the translator profession and business expectations:
advantages.benefit1: Considerable time savings: processing large volumes in minutes.
advantages.benefit2: Reduced costs: fewer human resources needed than with manual translation.
advantages.benefit3: An asset for specializations (legal, medical, technical, literary) thanks to translation memories and terminological databases.
advantages.benefit4: Increased productivity for translators, who have powerful tools to search, harmonize and automate certain tasks.

limitations.title: The limitations of AI in translation
limitations.paragraph1: Despite its performance, AI still faces major challenges:
limitations.limit1: Misinterpreted context: some sentences lose their subtlety.
limitations.limit2: Poorly translated cultural nuances: proverbs, puns, idioms escape algorithms.
limitations.limit3: Lack of fluency: texts can appear mechanical or artificial.
limitations.paragraph2: In short, AI cannot yet reproduce human creativity, sensitivity and intuition.

future.title: The future: an alliance between technology and human expertise
future.paragraph1: Rather than opposing AI and translators, we must think in terms of collaboration.
future.paragraph2: This complementarity opens the way to a new era: faster, more accurate translations adapted to the specific needs of clients.
future.paragraph3: Tomorrow's translators will need to adapt by:
future.adaptation3: and continuing to offer what AI cannot replace: the cultural imprint and the human touch.

conclusion.title: Conclusion
conclusion.paragraph1: Artificial intelligence does not replace translators, it transforms their profession. It allows them to gain efficiency while highlighting what makes them irreplaceable: their sensitivity, their culture and their expertise.
conclusion.highlight: üëâ In short, the future of translation relies on a strategic alliance between technological innovation and human skills.
